title: Rounded italic sans serif found on cookie packaging
content:
It includes some effects of course.  
Thank you so much for your help!

Font: 

 Erazure 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110725/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [morango.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110725/http:/typophile.com/files/morango.jpg) | 12.2 KB |
author: navarro

comments.content: It looks like a modified **[Erazure](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110725/http:/www.identifont.com/show?410)** by Panache Graphics and FontHaus [1993]

Absolutely! They replaced the "M" for a roundier, shorter and thicker custom version. The "r" and "a" are thinner and the "o" is thicker.  
Thank you for your help :-)
